children.name: fresh a2
children.definition: fresh (of food) has recently been picked or prepared, and is not frozen or preserved :tươi, xanh
examples: i go to the market twice a week to buy fresh fruit and vegetables.
fresh fish is much more delicious than frozen.
the beans are fresh from the garden.
put the milk in the fridge to keep it fresh.

children.name: processed x
children.definition: processed (of food) has been treated with chemicals that preserve it or give it extra taste or colour : đã chế biến
examples: the artificial colourings and flavourings in processed foods
processed cheese/ meat highly processed convenience foods

children.name: how long food can stay fresh
keep b2
children.definition: keep (of food) to stay fresh and in good condition to be eaten: giữ được, để được
examples: milk keeps much longer in a fridge.
eat the salmon because it won’t keep till tomorrow.

children.name: long-life x
children.definition: long-life long-life foods stay fresh longer than ordinary ones : để được lâu

children.name: defrost x
children.definition: defrost to (cause to) become no longer frozen : rã đông
examples: defrost the chicken thoroughly before cooking.

children.name: reconstitute x
children.definition: reconstitute to change dried food back to its original form by adding water to it : hoàn lại, khôi phục lại
examples: the powdered milk/ egg can be reconstituted by adding water.
the reconstitution of the communist party

children.name: preserve x
children.definition: preserve to store food for a long time after treating it so that it will not decay : bảo quản

children.name: process x
children.definition: process to make food ready to be used or sold, for example by preserving or improving them in some way : chế biến
examples: goats’ cheese may be processed in many ways.

children.name: canned b2
children.definition: cannedus b2/ tinneduk
examples: preserved and sold in a metal container
can[t] to put food and drink into a closed metal container from which all the air is removed: đóng hộp
he works in a factory where they can fruit.

children.name: vacuum-packed x
children.definition: vacuum-packed (of food) sealed in a pack or wrapping from which the air has been removed: đóng gói chân không

children.name: potted x
children.definition: potted uk potted meat or fish has been cooked and stored in a container, usually in the form of a paste for spreading on bread : đóng hộp (thịt, cá)

children.name: tin b2
children.definition: tinukcookie jarus  a metal container with a lid used for keeping cakes or biscuits : hộp (đựng bánh)

children.name: tea caddy x
children.definition: caddy a small container, especially one for storing tea leaves : hộp trà
examples: tea caddy[ c ] a container to keep tea leaves in : hộp trà, hộp chè

children.name: foil x
children.definition: foil metal sheets that are as thin as paper, used for wrapping food : giấy gói thức ăn
examples: cover the chicken with silver foil and bake.

children.name: tub x
children.definition: tub a small container made of paper or plastic with a lid, in which food is bought or stored : hộp

children.name: can a2
children.definition: can/ tinuk b1  a closed metal container, especially a cylindrical one, in which some types of drink and food are sold : hộp, lon
examples: a coke can/ piles of soup tins
all we’ve got is a couple of cans of soup.

children.name: cling film x
children.definition: cling filmukplastic wrapus  thin, transparent, plastic material, used for wrapping food to keep it fresh : giấy bóng gói thức ăn
examples: i've put some cling film over the salad.

children.name: lunchbox x
children.definition: lunchbox a box in which your lunch can be carried to work, school etc: hộp cơm trưa;

children.name: to preserve using sugar or salty water
in brine x
children.definition: brine water with salt in it, especially when used to preserve food : nước muối

children.name: candied x
children.definition: candiedpreserved by boiling in sugar : ngào đường

children.name: pickle x
children.definition: pickle to preserve vegetables or fruit in a vinegar sauce or salty water : làm dưa, dầm chua
examples: pickling onions (= small onions of a type which are kept in vinegar)
pickling spices (= used to give extra flavour to preserved vegetables)
pickled[adj] kept in vinegar : dầm, ngâm

children.name: crystallized x
children.definition: crystallized/ crystalliseduk  soaked in melted sugar which has then become hard : ngâm đường

children.name: glacé x
children.definition: glacéus/ glacéedus  glacé fruits, especially cherries, have been covered in sugary liquid : ngâm đường

children.name: freeze-dry x
children.definition: freeze-dry to preserve food, by freezing and then drying it : ướp lạnh và làm khô

children.name: smoke x
children.definition: smoke to preserve meat, fish or cheese using smoke from burning wood : hun khói
examples: people in the middle east, south asia and egypt were salting, drying and smoking fish and meat 6000 years ago.
smoked[attri adj]smoked salmon/bacon/sausage etcfish, meat etc that has been left in smoke to give it a special taste
she had champagne and smokedsalmonsandwiches at her birthday party.

children.name: pasteurize x
children.definition: pasteurize/ pasteuriseuk  to heat sth, especially milk, at a controlled temperature for a fixed period of time in order to kill bacteria : làm tiệt trùng
examples: dairies were now required by law to pasteurize milk

children.name: freeze b1
children.definition: freeze to preserve food for a long time by keeping it at a very low temperature, or to be preserved in this way :ướp lạnh, để lạnh
examples: i think i’ll freeze that extra meat.
you can make a big batch and freeze some of it for later.
don’t freeze the rolls for longer than three weeks.
frozen[adj] b1 (of food) preserved by freezing : ướp lạnh
all i had in the freezer was a couple of frozen pizzas.
we don't have any fresh vegetables, only frozen peas.

children.name: refrigerate x
children.definition: refrigerate to put food or drink in a refrigerator in order to keep it cold and fresh:ướp lạnh
examples: cover the bowl and refrigerate the dough overnight.
poultry, fish, and seafood should be kept refrigerated.
fresh orange juice should be refrigerated after opening and drunk within three days.

children.name: dried x
children.definition: dried (of food or plants) have had all their liquid removed, especially in order to preserve them được sấy khô; làm khô; hong khô
examples: sun-dried[attri adj] sun-dried food has been left in the sun to dry in order to give it a particular taste: phơi khô
